body: Please see https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/IMPALA/Contributing+to+Impala for instructions on how to submit bug reports or send patch contributions.

We don't accepts PRs through github. We track issues at https://issues.apache.org/jira/projects/IMPALA and do code reviews through gerrit.cloudera.org (see https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/IMPALA/Contributing+to+Impala)
@timarmstrong, Thank you. I have submit code to https://gerrit.cloudera.org

Thank you for your interest in contributing to Impala! We do code review via gerrit rather than GitHub PRs; you can see the process described at https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/IMPALA/Contributing+to+Impala

Posted to gerrit; doing pre-commit Jenkins job now:

https://gerrit.cloudera.org/#/c/8378/
apologize for these pull requests :(

Thanks for the patch! We use Gerrit for code review. Do you mind submitting your patch through there?

https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/IMPALA/Contributing+to+Impala
https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/IMPALA/Using+Gerrit+to+submit+and+review+patches

Thanks!
Sure. Will do that. Thank you.

Hi @akki, thanks for your patch! we use Gerrit for code reviews. You can see our process here: https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/IMPALA/Contributing+to+Impala and https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/IMPALA/Using+Gerrit+to+submit+and+review+patches.

Thanks!
See above - we use Gerrit for code review.

@jbapple @jbapple-cloudera I tried following the instructions in the guide but I cannot find any "Publish" button to send a PR to the master. Can you please help me understand what else needs to be done. If possible can you just review it here or share with me any quicker way of getting it reviewed. I just wanted to help the Impala-project with some relevant code that I had written but the barrier to entry seems very high to me for just a 30-line patch.

Hi @akki, don't worry, we can see your patch.

The "Publish" button only exists when you submit your patch as draft (i.e. git push asf-gerrit HEAD:refs/drafts/master). I guess you push to "refs/for/master" so you don't have this button.

Search around in the JIRAs, I found some issues about Python 3 support:

- https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IMPALA-3343
- https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IMPALA-8373

Do you have any interests to make the impala-shell compatible with Python 3 too?

@stiga-huang Great, nice to hear that.

Sure, I can try to help with the other issues but I believe it would be better if I get this PR merged first to make sure I understand the whole Gerrit system properly - honestly for me that was the most daunting part.
If you have any suggestions for my current work, I would love to hear them.

Thanks again for your comment and looking into this.
Looks like requests is up-to-date now, so this is no longer needed.
Looks like urllib3 is up-to-date now, so this is no longer needed.

Thank you for your interest in contributing to Impala! We do code review via gerrit rather than GitHub PRs; you can see the process described at https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/IMPALA/Contributing+to+Impala
@bartash Thanks for the information.  I've mentally stewed on this issue a bit more and think the existing code is probably better.  Will follow up if I still think this change is needed.
@bartash I posted a patch on JIRA. Maybe someone can take a look at that.  The gerrit process is a bit more than I bargained for.  Thanks for the help.

Thank you for your interest in contributing to Impala! We do code review via gerrit rather than GitHub PRs; you can see the process described at https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/IMPALA/Contributing+to+Impala
Aborting this, as this needs to be reviewed in gerrit -> http://gerrit.cloudera.org:8080/17523

OK, I won't notify you again about this release, but will get in touch when a new version is available. If you'd rather skip all updates until the next major or minor version, let me know by commenting `@dependabot ignore this major version` or `@dependabot ignore this minor version`.

If you change your mind, just re-open this PR and I'll resolve any conflicts on it.

Hi @jbapple maybe we should considering disable the dependabot's noisy alerts following this guide: https://docs.github.com/en/code-security/dependabot/dependabot-alerts/configuring-dependabot-alerts#enabling-or-disabling-dependabot-alerts-for-a-repository.

Hi @lide-reed, thanks for your contribution. We don't use pull requests in Apache Impala, we use Gerrit instead: [https://gerrit.cloudera.org/](https://gerrit.cloudera.org/)
Please upload your change request there. Also, we use Jira to track issues and reference Jira tickets in the commit message. An example is https://gerrit.cloudera.org/#/c/19839/ for which the Jira issue https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IMPALA-12119 was created.
Thanks,
Daniel
Here is the wiki for uploading patches for review: https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/IMPALA/Using+Gerrit+to+submit+and+review+patches
